intro: Eremosis steetzii var. callilepis, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for arid and coastal environments. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
